Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <perfectr> quick question

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <perfectr> what happens to the hush we had on our t addresses?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <perfectr> !tip 2 random users 10 hush

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <tip.cc> :HUSH: @perfectr sent @Bithorny and @Docrec **5.00 HUSH** (‚âà $0.36) each :cloud_rain:.
*Use `!tip nomention` to stop being pinged by tips.*

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @perfectr are you talking about the old Hush v2 chain balances?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gilardh> @perfectr They are not lost.  There are now on the new blockchain.  The private key does not change.  But you will have a new address.  You must not use the address t anymore.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> yes, @gilardh is correct

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> you can use your old wallet.dat with the new hushd or SilentDragon, and sweep funds out

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that is probably the easiest way. If you just have 1 or a few private keys for a few addresses, you can import those via the CLI

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> hopefully the next version of the SD GUI can import them

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> i am not sure, maybe @denio knows if SDL can import an old Hush privkey. Probably not but it could learn how

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> There is no time limit to convert your funds, you can wait until the Heat Death Of The Universe if you want

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> technically zaddr funds from our old chain are "lost", but we have set aside part of our Founders Reward in case anybody ever comes forward and can prove they had zaddr funds on the old Hush chain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> there was about 70,000 HUSH in zaddrs on the old Hush chain, iirc

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Nobody has ever come forward to claim them, and most likely they are from very early miners/users of Hush that lost or forgot about their wallets

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> And this bears repeating: When using your old wallet.dat on a new Hush chain: SWEEP FUNDS OUT, do not use that old wallet indefinitely. It will cause problems

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> If you need help, ask in #wallet-support

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <perfectr> @dukeleto yes
@gilardh ah I see so they are still recover-able, I'll try to use the SilentDragon and see if I can get them back, so I can just send them to a new R address without any issues?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gilardh> @perfectr You do not have to transfer your funds to a new R address. You will automatically have a new R address.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gilardh not quite right, it's best to transfer to a new address created in a new wallet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <join> @dukeleto morning sr

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @perfectr yes, make a new Hush address, backup that wallet.dat. Then use your old wallet.dat in SilentDragon, and send all funds to the new address

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> then, move the old wallet.dat out of the way one last time, and go back to your newly created wallet.dat

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gilardh> why ? @dukeleto

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> using an old wallet.dat on a different blockchain means all the transactions are invalid

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it means your wallet.dat is very large, full of xtns that are invalid on the new chain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> makes many things slow

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and finds bad bugs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's a "hack" that works, because KMD and HUSH are compatible with Bitcoin at a deep level

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's not something that is a "best practice"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's a way to recover coins

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gilardh> Ok, thanks for this information.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> you could also start HUSH with your Bitcoin wallet.dat or vice versa

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the same stuff would be true

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> you would own all the equivalent addresses

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and your transactions would be invalid

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> owning an address on any Bitcoin-derived network means you own it on all Bitcoin-derived networks

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> because it's really a 256bit pubkey

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that is rendered as an address üôÇ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> addresses do not exist on the blockchain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gilardh> (I use a private key not wallet.dat...) Gloops

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> üôÇ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <franciscana23> Nice

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ```
Howdy Anons,

We wanted y'all to know that the Hush cryptocoin (built upon Bitcoin and Zcash Protocols) has been working on privacy tech longer than almost any other cryptocoin, and we have real usable products today, and more in the works.

We started as one of the first few Zcash forks in 2016 and now are built with Komodo (KMD) tech, which is a Zcash fork with large improvements.

You can learn more about our project here: https://myhush.org and you are cordially invited to our 
Discord: http://myhush.org/discord

One of our exciting new developments is being able to take these amazing ideas from 2 years ago:

https://github.com/leto/hushlist/blob/master/whitepaper/protocol.pdf

and apply them to our new mainnet which is drastically improved.

You can support our project by investing in Hush (you can learn more here: https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/hush/¬†) or we would love to talk about receiving a donation
if your group feels our community is worthwhile.

Thanks
```
